thread.title: Lady Cardinal golf takes fifth in conference
thread.title_full: Lady Cardinal golf takes fifth in conference

author: Troy Tennyson Twitter: @ttennysonTDR
title: Lady Cardinal golf takes fifth in conference
text: Lady Cardinal golf takes fifth in conference Comment   Troy Tennyson Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 2:10 PM By Troy Tennyson Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 2:10 PM Coldwater, Mich. BATTLE CREEK – In the Interstate 8 conference championships held at Bedford Valley Golf Course in Battle Creek, the Coldwater Lady Cardinal golf team finished in fifth place with a team score of 420. Jackson Lumen Christi and Charlotte tied for the lead, each shooting 395, however Lumen Christi won the event on a tiebreaker. Parma Western was third with a 404, while Harper Creek finished in fourth with a score of 415. Coldwater was fifth followed by Marshall, and Jackson Northwest. The Lady Cardinals ended the season in fifth place overall in the Interstate 8 conference, with Jackson Lumen Christi winning the league championship. Coldwater was led on the day by Haley Linton who shot a round of 99, which earned her Interstate 8 All Conference honors as one of the top eight girls in the conference. Molly Smith shot a 105, while Jayla Goodwin added a 107, Claire Sheppard had a 109, Gabriel Boston carded a 116, while Madison Donbrock added a 118. Donbrock was named Honorable Mention Interstate 8 All Conference for her performance throughout the year. Coldwater Freshman volleyball wins two COLDWATER — The Coldwater Lady Cardinal Freshman competed in a JV tri-meet at Brooklyn Columbia Central Thursday, coming away with two wins. In the first game, the freshman Cardinals defeated the Jackson JV squad in three sets by scores of 22-25, 25-21, and 15-5. In game number two, the Lady Cardinals defeated Brooklyn Columbia Central in two sets by scores of 25-20 and 25-17. Leading the way for the Cardinals was Jordan Clemens with 12 kills, 12 assists, and five digs; Maya Tom with four kills, seven aces, and four digs; Anna Tappaden with 12 assists, nine digs, and four kills; Carly Wilson with six digs and three aces; and Malorie Kissinger with four kills, nine assists, and three digs. The two wins improves the Cardinal's record to 22-1 on the season. Coldwater LMS volleyball sees action COLDWATER – The Coldwater Legg Middle School volleyball teams faced off with Harper Creek middle school Thursday in Interstate 8 conference action. The Coldwater eighth grade “A” team beat Harper Creek Thursday in two sets by scores of 21-7 and 21-11. Carrigan Carpenter led the way with seven points, two assists, and three kills, while Olivia Foley added seven points, five aces, three digs, three kills, and one assist. Also contributing to the winning effort was Bailey Burkhardt who had four kills; Carlee Crabtree had two kills and one block; Abby Thatcher had four assists; and Emma Moore and Madison Klotz each had two points. In seventh grade action, the “A” volleyball team defeated Harper Creek in three sets by scores of 21-13, 21-19, and 15-9. At the service line Coldwater was paced by Abby Herman who went 12-13 with seven aces while Laynee Paarlberg went 8-9 with two aces. Annkate Dwyer added a 9-10 effort. Page 2 of 2 - Kaia Donay, Alyssa Bach, and Abby Herman each had three kills followed by Madison Beckhusen and Mia Rzepka with two kills. Rzepka had five assists while Beckhusen had four assists to lead the team. Beckhusen, Paarlberg, Bach, and Herman had six digs each, followed by Meg Smith and Veronica Gonzalez with four each, followed by Dwyer, Rzepka, and Gonzalez with three each. On the year the “A” team record now stands at 10-0-2. The seventh grade “B” team defeated Harper Creek in three sets by scores of 21-10, 22-20, and 15-7. Leading scorers for the Cardinals were Alyssa Stevens with seven points and Brianna Rousch with five points. By Troy Tennyson   Troy Tennyson
